channel.title: The Best AntiVirus
channel.description: I want to know what the you guys think is the best [b][u]Anti-Virus[/u][/b] not Internet security or Anti-Spyware but [b][u]Anti-Virus[/u][/b]. I would like it if you would reply and tell us why you voted for whatever you voted for.

item.title: The Best AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:34, topic:150262”]Why are so many people say Norton is the best? Just Google Why Norton is Bad. Here’s a quote from one article.

[quote=http://www.news.com/5208-1029_3-0.html?forumID=1&threadID=14525&messageID=120815&start=-1]
I actually dumped the 2005 version of Norton Internet Security, having to reformat my drive and re-install windows 2000 to get rid of it. I had just purchased it and and didn’t ask for a refund. I used AVG Free version for a year and have replaced that with NOD32 from Eset. Norton 2005 completely screwd up my system to where I couldn’t use it. I recomend either AVG or NOD32, the latter being bit lighter on system resource usage.[/quote]

And another quote if you do some digging.

[quote=http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20070611125515AAIRMhM]
My personal, very personal opinion is to dislike Norton for four reasons. (1) Their documentation is very difficult to read and non-informative. (2) Their support is very poor and, if acquired in person, extremely expensive. (3) Their software does a poor job of malware detection and removal and must be suplemented via use of other software agents. (4) Their software digs itself deeply into a system to the extent it is EXTREMELY difficult to remove, requiring not only uninstall but also use of utilities acquired from Symantec plus utilities acquired via Google search plus substantial effort on the computer owner’s part.

Another personal gripe is the manner in which Norton/Symantec software has “wedded” itself into other products so that trial versions come pre-installed on, for example, Windows systems and Linksys routers…
[/quote][/quote]

Because there gullible and been set in their ways?

gsheni:

LOL I know Linux D is a different operating system but why do people use it I mean why not xp or vista and get a really good antivirus. Someone tell me why because all I heard is because it has a less chance of getting hacked.

Linux is free, and it is 100% open source. There are few viruses for Linux, and there far apart. Linux however, is a lot more secure, and if you do happen to find a security flaw, you can fix it yourself rather than hoping microsoft will get it and fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Best AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Why are so many people say Norton is the best? Just Google Why Norton is Bad. Here’s a quote from one article.

I actually dumped the 2005 version of Norton Internet Security, having to reformat my drive and re-install windows 2000 to get rid of it. I had just purchased it and and didn't ask for a refund. I used AVG Free version for a year and have replaced that with NOD32 from Eset. Norton 2005 completely screwd up my system to where I couldn't use it. I recomend either AVG or NOD32, the latter being bit lighter on system resource usage.

And another quote if you do some digging.

My personal, very personal opinion is to dislike Norton for four reasons. (1) Their documentation is very difficult to read and non-informative. (2) Their support is very poor and, if acquired in person, extremely expensive. (3) Their software does a poor job of malware detection and removal and must be suplemented via use of other software agents. (4) Their software digs itself deeply into a system to the extent it is EXTREMELY difficult to remove, requiring not only uninstall but also use of utilities acquired from Symantec plus utilities acquired via Google search plus substantial effort on the computer owner's part.

Another personal gripe is the manner in which Norton/Symantec software has “wedded” itself into other products so that trial versions come pre-installed on, for example, Windows systems and Linksys routers…

Read full topic

item.title: The Best AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

NOD32 is the best, McAfee and Avast! are only one step better than Norton. Norton only protects you from a few viruses and you will NEVER be able to remove it from your computer unless you completely reinstall Windows. Sound like a program you want?

Read full topic

item.title: The Best AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’ve had Norton before, liked it while I had it but really, I changed to NOD32 then Kaspersky, and DAMN, what a difference that made. I voted for Kaspersky, since it has a full suit(I know you said don’t vote for this), however I’d say NOD32 + Kaspersky are pretty much the same.

Norton is slow, hogs system memory, it’s annoying, and it can go very unresponsive at times.

Read full topic
